title: Principles and Applications of Solar Absorber Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic physics (optics/thermodynamics) and fundamental concepts of materials science
context.additional_context: Integration of smartphone-based digital content utilization with offline activities through the creation of experimental kits.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the operating principles of selective absorbers in the solar spectrum and infrared regions.
Learners can implement optimization algorithms for multilayer nanostructure design using simulation tools.
Learners can quantitatively analyze photothermal effects through experimental designs that measure the efficiency of solar absorbers.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
